page.title: 15PUBLIC TRANSPORT
page.content: London Regional Transport runs a wide range of services. You can catch buses to Romford, Dagenham, Barking and Ilford. Out of 333 children we found 19 of their parents used the bus to go to work, 60 to go shopping and 29 of their brothers and sisters used a bus to travel to their Secondary School. There are 'Underground' stations at Hornchurch and Upminster Bridge. These trains run on the District Line between Upminster and Central London. British Rail operate a branch line in our area. The station is called Emerson Park. People can go shopping in Romford or Upminster. The line is most busy when it is used by commuters. In June 1985 the trains were changed from deisel to electric. 13 parents use it daily. 62 parents use it at least monthly.
